m_szDocTitle: Paris Agreement Set To Boost Wind Turbine Sales, According To Moody's | CleanTechnica
m_szDocSumamry: textArticle -------------------- June 10th, 2016 by Joshua S Hill   The Paris Agreement, which was agreed upon at COP21 in Paris in December, is set to boost wind turbine manufacturer sales, according to a new report from Moody’s. According to a new report from Moody’s Investors Service, the Paris Agreement, which was agreed upon at the 21st session of the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change Conference of the Parties (COP21) and signed by at least 165 countries earlier this year, will give a tremendous boost to the sale of wind turbines in the coming years.
